title: Animal Bite
description: An animal bite occurs when an animal’s teeth puncture the skin, potentially causing injury or infection. These bites can come from domestic pets such as dogs and cats, or from wild animals.

sections.heading: Symptoms of an Animal Bite
sections.content: Pain and swelling at the bite site, bleeding from the puncture wound, redness or warmth around the area, bruising or tenderness, pus or discharge if infected, and fever if infection develops.

sections.heading: Steps for Animal Bite Treatment
sections.content:
1) Clean the wound immediately with soap and water, rinsing under running water for several minutes.
2) Stop bleeding by applying gentle pressure with a clean cloth; elevate the injured area if bleeding is severe.
3) Apply an antiseptic solution like iodine or hydrogen peroxide to prevent infection.
4) Cover the wound with a sterile bandage, ensuring it’s not too tight; change bandage daily or when dirty.
5) Monitor the wound for signs of infection such as redness, swelling, or pus.

sections.heading: Precautions to Prevent Infection
sections.content:
Keep the wound clean by washing daily.
Change bandages regularly.
Avoid squeezing pus or popping the wound.
Seek medical care immediately for rabies or tetanus vaccination if the animal’s health status is unknown.

sections.heading: When to Seek Emergency Care
sections.content:
If bleeding is severe and won’t stop after pressure.
Bites from wild or sick-appearing animals.
Deep puncture wounds or large bites.
Signs of infection including fever.
Bites to the face or neck.
Potential rabies exposure from abnormal animals like bats, raccoons, or foxes.

sections.heading: Emergency Treatment for Animal Bites
sections.content:
Tetanus vaccination for deep or dirty wounds.
Post-exposure rabies vaccination if needed.
Antibiotics for infection treatment or prevention.
Professional wound cleaning or stitches for severe injuries.

sections.heading: What Not to Do
sections.content:
Do NOT ignore deep or large bites.
Do NOT attempt serious bite treatment at home if the wound is severe or animal unknown.
Seek medical attention immediately in such cases.

sections.heading: Preventing Animal Bites
sections.content:
Avoid provoking animals and stay calm.
Keep pets vaccinated, especially dogs and cats.
Supervise children around animals.
Exercise caution with wild animals or stray pets.
